June 8 at 6:00 PM ·

Information about BFA's Graduation
Our graduation will have two parts this year:
The first part is our traditional ceremony which will be take place on Saturday at 10 AM. Students will be participating remotely, but all speeches will be live. This will be broadcast on Facebook live and through a link that will be shared later this week.
The second part will be for the student to pick up their diploma and walk across the stage at BFA. Their family will be present to witness this momentous accomplishment. Due to current health guidelines, this event will be restricted to our graduates and their families. We will live stream the presentation of diplomas as well. The first student is scheduled to receive their diploma at 12:30. PM. We anticipate that the last student will cross the stage at about 6:30 PM.
Please stay tuned for links and reminders.

Grow Hope - Plant a Seed! Project Comes to Fletcher Elementary

In collaboration with the Healthy Roots Collaborative and RiseVT, Fletcher Elementary is participating in the Grow Hope - Plant a Seed! project. During this unusual time, the project provides gardening fun (free bean seeds) and an instructional and informative flyer about the benefits of growing a resilient local food system. The flyer and the seeds are being distributed to those who receive meals from school today, and will be available for pickup by other Fletcher Elementary families from the school lobby after 10:00 AM today. The package also includes suggestions for exploring soil types, critters that live in soil, and a variety of seeds found in our environment. Enjoy!

When I was an English major in college, one of my favorite authors was Flannery O’Connor. Toward the end of her life, she wrote a collection of short stories entitled Everything That Rises Must Converge. I loved that book of stories and remember thinking about what the title meant in relationship to each of the characters in those nine stories. But more than anything, what stuck with me was that title, which seemed so loaded with meaning that I have rolled it over and over in my mind perennially. [ 764 more words ]

post_text:
To celebrate Fire Safety Month in October, the Fletcher Elementary School welcomed a special visit from the Cambridge Fire Department. Three firefighters taught a series of 45-minute lessons on fire safety to each of Fletcher's preschool through sixth-grade classes. The teaching included a review of the gear and equipment used by firefighters, strategies for staying safe in the event of a fire, and a tour of a real-life fire-rescue truck. [ 517 more words ]
